author: From wsj.com
title: Ferrari Revs Up for IPO
text: From wsj.com After a glitzy roadshow, Ferraris long-awaited initial public offering is finally at the starting line, with the stock likely to be priced Tuesday and the first day of trading on the New York Stock Exchange expected Wednesday. Investors will be carefully watching the stocks initial performance, given the rich price range set for the new shares and a difficult IPO market. Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV is selling about 10% of Ferrari in the IPO. At the top of its projected range of $48 to $52 a share, the sports-car maker would have a stock-market value of $9.8 billion. That range is much higher than most initial forecasts when plans ... (
